hadiths.context: The best among you are those who are the most beneficial to others.
The reward for deeds depends on the intention behind them.
Praying in congregation is 27 times more rewarding than praying alone.
The best of you are those who are best to their wives.
A believer is like a bee; whatever it does, it is good.
None of you will have faith until you love for your brother what you love for yourself.
He who does not show mercy to others, will not be shown mercy by Allah.
The one who shows you kindness, return it with kindness, and if they cannot, at least show kindness.
The one who fasts with a sincere intention for Allah will be forgiven for his sins.
The best of you are those who are most mindful of Allah.
When you greet someone, greet them with peace.
The one who seeks knowledge is like a person fasting in the cause of Allah.
The one who prays at night is like a knight standing firm in the cause of Allah.
Fear Allah wherever you are, and follow up a bad deed with a good deed to erase it.
A believer is one who seeks to protect his fellow believers from harm.
Whoever helps his brother, Allah will help him.
Charity does not decrease wealth.
Whoever guides to good will have a reward equal to the one who does it.
A person’s heart will be at peace if he trusts in Allah’s decree.
The strong believer is better and more beloved to Allah than the weak believer, while there is good in both.
Actions are judged by intentions, and each person will be rewarded according to their intentions.
The one who prays the Fajr prayer in congregation is like a person who stays awake the whole night.
When a person performs Hajj sincerely, his sins will be forgiven.
Whoever performs the prayer sincerely, his sins will be forgiven.
The best of you are those who learn the Qur’an and teach it.
Give charity without delay, for it stands in the way of calamity.
Fasting is a shield against the Hellfire.
Whoever seeks Allah’s forgiveness will be forgiven, regardless of his sins.
The one who fears Allah and shows patience, Allah will reward him without measure.
The best of you are those who are most beneficial to others.
The one who helps his brother in need will be rewarded by Allah.
A person who remembers Allah is like a living person, and one who does not is like a dead person.
Whosoever performs a good deed will have its reward multiplied.
Whoever fasts the month of Ramadan with faith and seeking reward, his past sins will be forgiven.
The one who fulfills his oath will be rewarded by Allah.
The best of you are those who show kindness to their wives.
Make peace between people, for Allah loves those who reconcile.
The one who strives in the cause of Allah will be rewarded with Paradise.
The most beloved to Allah are those who are most beneficial to His creation.
A believer who visits a sick believer will have his sins forgiven.
The best of you are those who have the best character.
The one who prays at night with sincerity will be forgiven.
When you help others, you are actually helping yourself.
Seeking knowledge is an obligation upon every Muslim.
The best among you are those who have the best manners and character.
Charity does not decrease wealth.
The closest that a servant comes to his Lord is when he is prostrating.
Indeed, with every hardship there is ease.
Truth leads to righteousness, and righteousness leads to Paradise.
Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should maintain the ties of kinship.
He who does not thank people, does not thank Allah.
Whoever says: 'Astaghfirullaha Rabbi min kulli dhambin wa atubu ilayh' (I seek forgiveness from Allah, my Lord, from all sins and turn to Him in repentance), Allah will forgive his sins.
When a servant of Allah does good deeds, Allah will increase him in goodness.
Whoever follows my Sunnah, loves me and will be with me in Paradise.
Fasting is a shield, and the one who fasts will be protected from the Hellfire.
Allah's mercy prevails over His wrath.
Dua is the essence of worship.
The example of the one who remembers Allah and the one who does not is like that of the living and the dead.
Whoever helps his brother, Allah will help him.
Fear Allah wherever you are, and follow up a bad deed with a good deed to erase it, and behave well towards people.
Whoever humbles himself for the sake of Allah, Allah will elevate him.
Prayer in congregation is twenty-seven times more rewarding than prayer performed alone.
Sadaqah extinguishes the sins as water extinguishes the fire.
Actions are judged by intentions, and every person will be rewarded according to what he intended.
The best of you are those who are the best to their women.
None of you will have faith until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.
Whoever relieves a believer's distress, Allah will relieve his distress on the Day of Judgment.
Do not backbite one another. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? You would hate it.
A strong believer is better and more beloved to Allah than a weak believer, while there is good in both.
Actions are judged by intentions, and every person will be rewarded according to what he intended.
The one who shows you kindness, respond with greater kindness, but if they cannot, at least show kindness in return.
The best of you are those who are best in paying their debts.
Whoever performs Hajj and does not commit any obscenity or wrongdoing will return as pure from his sins as the day his mother bore him.
When you greet, greet with peace. That is better for you.
Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should speak good or remain silent.
The strong man is not the one who is able to wrestle, but the one who controls himself when he is angry.
Beware of suspicion, for suspicion is the most false of speech.
The one who guides to good will have the reward equal to the one who performs the good action.
Whoever performs the prayer sincerely for Allah's sake, will find that it will prevent him from indecency and wrongdoing.
The prayer of a person in congregation is 27 times more rewarding than the prayer of one who prays alone.
The best of people are those who are most beneficial to others.
If you are kind, Allah will be kind to you.
There is no superiority of an Arab over a non-Arab, nor of a non-Arab over an Arab, except by piety.
A believer is like a bee; whatever it does, it is good.
Make peace between people, for Allah loves those who reconcile.
If a Muslim greets another Muslim with peace, he will be rewarded with Paradise.
If you ask Allah for something, do so with the confidence that He will give you.
A person’s heart will be at peace if he trusts in Allah's decree.
The best charity is that which is given by a wealthy person, and the best fasting is that which is done with sincere intention.
Whoever hides a fault of his brother, Allah will hide his faults on the Day of Judgment.
Whosoever says, 'Subhanallah wa bihamdi' (Glory is to Allah, and all praise is due to Him) 100 times in a day, his sins will be forgiven.
The one who prays at night is like a knight who stands firm in the cause of Allah.
The best of you are those who are best to their wives.
Do not envy one another, and do not turn away from each other.
The one who seeks knowledge is like the one who is fasting in the cause of Allah.
Whoever loves for Allah and dislikes for Allah, has perfected his faith.
A believer’s heart is tender and full of mercy.
When you see someone who is in need, help them, for you will be rewarded by Allah.
One of the best deeds in the sight of Allah is maintaining family ties.
The one who does not show mercy will not be shown mercy by Allah.
A person’s faith is not complete until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.
Do not commit adultery, for it will bring misery and hardship.
The one who believes in Allah and the Last Day should be careful about what he says.
When you fast, keep your intentions pure for Allah alone.
The most beloved of people to Allah are those who are most beneficial to others.
Actions are judged by the intention behind them.
The best of you are those who have the best character.
The one who purifies himself for prayer and prays sincerely for Allah will be forgiven.
Whosoever does not forgive others, Allah will not forgive him.
The best of you are those who are most charitable.
